value.title: Elon Musk says his AI brain chip company Neuralink will run a live tech demo of a 'working device' on Friday
value.excerpt: Musk said in May Neuralink could begin human testing within a year, although experts have questioned this timeline.

value.title: Baidu Is Searching For Quantum AI Advantage
value.excerpt: Baidu, China’s leading search engine and AI powerhouse, recently announced Paddle Quantum, a quantum machine learning development toolkit. This was the latest in a series of steps Baidu has taken to marry quantum computing with AI since establishing its Institute for Quantum Computing in 2018.

value.title: China Still Buying $300 Billion of Chips From U.S., Elsewhere
value.excerpt: China will import $300 billion of semiconductors for the third straight year, underscoring how the world’s No. 2 economy remains tied to America despite billions invested in local chip-making know-how.

value.title: SINTRONES Edge AI GPU Computing Solution enabling flexibility: EBOX-7000
value.excerpt: SINTRONES, one of the global leaders in computing technology in vehicles, announces the launch of the new EBOX-7000 Edge AI GPU Computing. The new EBOX-7000 Edge AI GPU Computing is suitable for various factory automation and Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) control system in large-scale processes such as mining and manufacturing.

value.title: Losses mount at British unicorn Graphcore as it pours cash into AI chips

value.title: Microsoft Deploys AI ‘Supercomputing’ via Nvidia’s New Ampere A100 GPU
value.excerpt: Microsoft is ramping up a new set of AI instances for its customers. The new Nvidia Ampere-powered servers are powerful enough to qualify for supercomputer status, at least in some configurations.

value.title: Nvidia’s server business eclipses gaming chips for first time, though maybe not for long

value.title: Xilinx’s programmable AI chip powers safety sensors in Subaru car
value.excerpt: Xilinx said that its programmable AI chip has been used in the EyeSight safety system in the new Subaru Levorg vehicle.

value.title: Microsoft's New Azure Servers Deliver Powerful NVIDIA A100 Ampere AI Supercomputing Boost

value.title: Cerebras puts ‘world’s largest computer chip’ in Lassen supercomputer
value.excerpt: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory said it has integrated Cerebras Systems' wafer-scale computer chip into its Lassen supercomputer.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Adds A100 GPU Instances for ‘Supercomputer-Class AI’ in the Cloud

value.title: Cerebras teases second-generation wafer-scale AI chip
value.excerpt: The existing Gen-1 has 18 gigabytes of DRAM on die. Lie told the audience to wait for details "in coming months." Cerebras competes with established GPU heavyweight Nvidia and other startups such as Graphcore and Tachyum.

value.title: Intel: Data bandwidth, sparsity are the two biggest challenges for AI chips
value.excerpt: The movement of data into and out of the processor is the biggest challenge for AI chips, but sparsity looms as an even greater challenge, according to Intel engineers.

value.title: IBM POWER10 Mega Chip For Hybrid Cloud Is Revealed
value.excerpt: The IBM POWER architecture has always delivered high-performance computing for business-critical workloads and looking to build on that legacy, they’ve just released the POWER10, tilting toward support for cloud workloads.

value.title: IBM Inks Deal With Samsung to Build its Latest Chip Processor
value.excerpt: International Business Machines Corporation IBM recently unveiled its latest chip processor — IBM POWER 10 — which will be manufactured by Samsung Electronics. The chip is primarily meant for use across data center operations and will be based on Samsung’s 7-nanometer (nm) process technology.

value.title: Photonics startup Lightmatter details P1, its AI optical accelerator chip
value.excerpt: Ahead of the Hot Chips 2020 conference this week, photonics chip startup Lightmatter detailed its forthcoming P1 accelerator hardware.

value.title: IBM unveils its first seven-nanometre chip for next-generation hybrid cloud computing
value.excerpt: IBM has announced the tenth generation of its flagship Power processors, a smaller, faster, more energy-efficient seven-nanometre chip that businesses can expect to deploy inside their data centres in the second half of 2021.

value.title: Elon Musk hints at Tesla’s not-so-secret Dojo AI-training supercomputer capacity
value.excerpt: Elon Musk has made a rare new comment about Tesla’s now not-so-secret ‘Dojo’ program to create an AI-training supercomputer and gave a hint of its capacity. value.title: IBM unveils Power10 processor for big data analytics and AI workloads
value.excerpt: At the Hot Chips 2020 virtual conference, IBM unveiled the Power10, its first commercial 7-nanometer processor, manufactured by Samsung.

value.title: Intel Xe-HPG: gaming GPU with ray tracing tech and GDDR6 ships in 2021
value.excerpt: Intel announces new Xe microarchitecture variant: Xe-HPG -- a gaming-optimized GPU with ray tracing and GDDR6 memory ships in 2021.

value.title: How Broadcom May Have Helped Make Google’s Latest AI Chip
value.excerpt: Broadcom’s application-specific integrated circuit business is currently generating $750 million in full-year revenue, up from $50 million in 2016, according to J.P. Morgan.

value.title: AI Is a New Weapon in the Battle Against Counterfeits
value.excerpt: Algorithms that can spot features invisible to the human eye are helping to protect retailers and shoppers from a glut of fake goods.
